break_the_ice.meaning: start a conversation in a social situation
break_the_ice.explanation: To overcome awkwardness at the beginning of a meeting or event
break_the_ice.example: She told a joke to break the ice at the party.
break_the_ice.hindi_meaning: सामाजिक परिस्थिति में बातचीत शुरू करना

bite_the_dust.explanation: To meet failure or come to an end
bite_the_dust.example: After years of struggle, the startup finally bit the dust.

call_it_a_day.meaning: stop working or finish for the day
call_it_a_day.explanation: To decide to stop what you are doing
call_it_a_day.example: It's late, let's call it a day and meet tomorrow.

come_rain_or_shine.meaning: no matter what happens; under any circumstances
come_rain_or_shine.explanation: To indicate that something will happen regardless of difficulties
come_rain_or_shine.example: I will complete this project come rain or shine.

cut_to_the_chase.meaning: get to the main point without wasting time
cut_to_the_chase.explanation: To skip unnecessary details and discuss the main issue
cut_to_the_chase.example: Let's cut to the chase and discuss the real problem.
cut_to_the_chase.hindi_meaning: बिना किसी लफ्फाजी के मुख्य बात कहना

down_in_the_dumps.explanation: To be in a state of sadness or unhappiness
down_in_the_dumps.example: He's been down in the dumps since he lost his job.

every_dog_has_its_day.meaning: everyone will have good luck or success at some point
every_dog_has_its_day.explanation: Everyone gets an opportunity to succeed
every_dog_has_its_day.example: Don't worry, every dog has its day. Your turn will come.
every_dog_has_its_day.hindi_meaning: हर किसी को अपना सफलता का दिन आता है

fall_on_deaf_ears.meaning: to be ignored; not be listened to
fall_on_deaf_ears.explanation: When advice or requests are not heard or paid attention to
fall_on_deaf_ears.example: His warnings fell on deaf ears.
fall_on_deaf_ears.hindi_meaning: किसी की बातों को नज़रअंदाज़ किया जाना

give_the_cold_shoulder.explanation: To treat someone with deliberate coldness
give_the_cold_shoulder.example: She gave him the cold shoulder after their argument.
give_the_cold_shoulder.hindi_meaning: किसी को ठंडेपन से व्यवहार करना

go_the_extra_mile.meaning: make a special effort; do more than required
go_the_extra_mile.explanation: To put in extra effort beyond what is expected
go_the_extra_mile.example: She always goes the extra mile for her customers.

golden_opportunity.meaning: a great or valuable chance to achieve something
golden_opportunity.explanation: A special opportunity that shouldn't be missed
golden_opportunity.example: Getting hired by Google was a golden opportunity for him.

hit_the_nail_on_the_head.english: hit the nail on the head
hit_the_nail_on_the_head.meaning: say or do something exactly right; be correct
hit_the_nail_on_the_head.explanation: To describe something accurately or find a solution
hit_the_nail_on_the_head.example: Your analysis hit the nail on the head.
hit_the_nail_on_the_head.hindi_meaning: किसी बात को बिल्कुल सही तरीके से कहना

hold_your_horses.meaning: wait, be patient, or slow down
hold_your_horses.explanation: To advise someone to wait or be less hasty
hold_your_horses.example: Hold your horses! Let's think about this carefully.

in_the_long_run.meaning: considering the whole time period; eventually
in_the_long_run.explanation: When looking at the overall effect or final result
in_the_long_run.example: It'll be cheaper in the long run to buy quality products.

jump_on_the_bandwagon.meaning: join a popular trend without thought
jump_on_the_bandwagon.explanation: To participate in something just because it's popular
jump_on_the_bandwagon.example: Everyone is jumping on the fitness bandwagon.
jump_on_the_bandwagon.hindi_meaning: बिना सोचे-समझे किसी फैशन का पालन करना

keep_your_chin_up.explanation: To encourage someone not to lose hope
keep_your_chin_up.example: Keep your chin up! Things will get better.

let_the_cat_out_of_the_bag.english: let the cat out of the bag
let_the_cat_out_of_the_bag.explanation: To unintentionally tell someone a secret
let_the_cat_out_of_the_bag.example: He let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party.
let_the_cat_out_of_the_bag.hindi_meaning: अनजाने में किसी रहस्य को बता देना

like_a_kid_in_a_candy_store.english: like a kid in a candy store
like_a_kid_in_a_candy_store.explanation: To show extreme joy and excitement
like_a_kid_in_a_candy_store.example: He looked like a kid in a candy store when he saw the new car.
like_a_kid_in_a_candy_store.hindi_meaning: किसी चीज़ से बहुत खुशी महसूस करना

look_before_you_leap.meaning: think before you act; consider consequences
look_before_you_leap.explanation: To advise careful thinking before taking action
look_before_you_leap.example: Look before you leap; don't make hasty decisions.
look_before_you_leap.hindi_meaning: कार्य करने से पहले परिणामों पर विचार करो

make_a_long_story_short.explanation: To tell only the essential facts without details
make_a_long_story_short.example: Make a long story short: we got lost and missed the meeting.

make_ends_meet.meaning: earn enough money to pay for basic needs
make_ends_meet.explanation: To have sufficient income for living expenses
make_ends_meet.example: Both parents work just to make ends meet.
make_ends_meet.hindi_meaning: बुनियादी ज़रूरतों के लिए पर्याप्त पैसा कमाना

miss_the_boat.explanation: To fail to take advantage of a chance
miss_the_boat.example: If you don't apply now, you'll miss the boat.

never_say_never.meaning: don't close the door on possibilities
never_say_never.explanation: To keep options open for future possibilities
never_say_never.example: I never thought I'd love the city, but never say never!
never_say_never.hindi_meaning: किसी बात को असंभव न मानो

no_pain_no_gain.meaning: you can't achieve success without effort
no_pain_no_gain.explanation: Hard work is necessary to achieve goals
no_pain_no_gain.example: No pain, no gain. You have to exercise to stay fit.
no_pain_no_gain.hindi_meaning: मेहनत के बिना सफलता नहीं मिलती

on_cloud_nine.explanation: To be in a state of extreme joy or happiness
on_cloud_nine.example: Ever since she got engaged, she's been on cloud nine.

once_in_a_blue_moon.example: I see him once in a blue moon.
once_in_a_blue_moon.hindi_meaning: लगभग कभी नहीं, दुर्लभ अवसर पर

out_of_the_frying_pan_into_the_fire.english: out of the frying pan into the fire
out_of_the_frying_pan_into_the_fire.meaning: go from one bad situation to a worse one
out_of_the_frying_pan_into_the_fire.explanation: To escape one problem only to enter another
out_of_the_frying_pan_into_the_fire.example: He quit his job but ended up out of the frying pan into the fire.
out_of_the_frying_pan_into_the_fire.hindi: एक मुसीबत से दूसरी में पड़ना
out_of_the_frying_pan_into_the_fire.hindi_meaning: बुरी परिस्थिति से और भी बदतर में जाना

play_it_safe.explanation: To choose a safe or cautious approach
play_it_safe.example: I decided to play it safe and not invest in that startup.
play_it_safe.hindi_meaning: जोखिम न लेकर सुरक्षित रास्ता चुनना

push_your_luck.meaning: try something risky; take a chance
push_your_luck.explanation: To try your luck beyond what's safe
push_your_luck.example: Don't push your luck; quit while you're ahead.

put_all_your_eggs_in_one_basket.english: put all your eggs in one basket
put_all_your_eggs_in_one_basket.meaning: risk everything on a single endeavor
put_all_your_eggs_in_one_basket.explanation: To rely entirely on one option without backup
put_all_your_eggs_in_one_basket.example: Don't put all your eggs in one basket; diversify your investments.
put_all_your_eggs_in_one_basket.hindi: सब कुछ एक ही जगह लगाना
put_all_your_eggs_in_one_basket.hindi_meaning: सब कुछ एक ही विकल्प पर निर्भर करना

quick_as_a_lick.explanation: To do something with great speed
quick_as_a_lick.example: He finished the project quick as a lick.

raining_cats_and_dogs.example: It's raining cats and dogs outside.

rain_on_your_parade.explanation: To prevent or diminish someone's joy
rain_on_your_parade.example: I didn't mean to rain on your parade.
rain_on_your_parade.hindi: किसी की खुशी में बाधा डालना
rain_on_your_parade.hindi_meaning: किसी के मज़े को बर्बाद करना

reap_what_you_sow.meaning: face the consequences of your actions
reap_what_you_sow.explanation: Good actions bring good results, bad actions bring bad results
reap_what_you_sow.example: You reap what you sow; if you work hard, you'll succeed.
reap_what_you_sow.hindi_meaning: अपनी किए गए बातों का नतीजा पाना

ring_a_bell.meaning: sound familiar; seem to remind you of something
ring_a_bell.explanation: To trigger a memory or recognition
ring_a_bell.example: That name rings a bell, but I can't place it.
ring_a_bell.hindi_meaning: किसी बात को याद आना या परिचित लगना

rock_the_boat.example: Don't rock the boat; everything is going well now.
rock_the_boat.hindi_meaning: शांति भंग करना या समस्या पैदा करना

run_in_circles.meaning: keep trying but make no progress
run_in_circles.explanation: To be stuck in a repetitive, unproductive situation
run_in_circles.example: We've been running in circles trying to fix this problem.
run_in_circles.hindi_meaning: कोशिश के बावजूद कोई प्रगति न करना

safe_and_sound.explanation: To be in a protected or secure condition
safe_and_sound.example: After the accident, we're all safe and sound.
safe_and_sound.hindi_meaning: पूरी तरह से सुरक्षित और अप्रभावित होना

shake_a_leg.explanation: To move quickly or dance enthusiastically
shake_a_leg.example: Come on, shake a leg! We're going to be late.

shed_light_on.meaning: explain something or make it clear
shed_light_on.explanation: To clarify or provide information about something
shed_light_on.example: This study sheds light on the causes of climate change.
shed_light_on.hindi_meaning: किसी बात को समझाना या स्पष्ट करना

shift_gears.example: We need to shift gears and focus on customer service.

ship_has_sailed.meaning: it's too late to do something
ship_has_sailed.explanation: An opportunity has passed and it's now impossible
ship_has_sailed.example: You wanted to join the team, but the ship has sailed.

shoot_for_the_moon.explanation: To pursue a difficult or high goal
shoot_for_the_moon.example: You should shoot for the moon even if you miss.
shoot_for_the_moon.hindi_meaning: महत्वाकांक्षी लक्ष्य के लिए कोशिश करना

shot_in_the_dark.explanation: An attempt made without much hope of success
shot_in_the_dark.example: It's just a shot in the dark, but maybe this will work.

show_your_true_colors.meaning: reveal your real personality or intentions
show_your_true_colors.explanation: To show who you really are
show_your_true_colors.example: During the crisis, everyone showed their true colors.

stick_your_neck_out.meaning: take a risk; go out on a limb
stick_your_neck_out.explanation: To expose yourself to criticism or danger for something
stick_your_neck_out.example: He stuck his neck out to defend his friend.

still_waters_run_deep.meaning: quiet people often have deep thoughts
still_waters_run_deep.explanation: A person who appears calm may have strong emotions
still_waters_run_deep.example: Don't underestimate him; still waters run deep.
still_waters_run_deep.hindi: शांत व्यक्ति गहरे विचार रखता है
still_waters_run_deep.hindi_meaning: शांत दिखने वाले लोग गहरे विचार रखते हैं

stop_and_smell_the_roses.meaning: take time to appreciate life's simple pleasures
stop_and_smell_the_roses.explanation: To pause and enjoy the present moment
stop_and_smell_the_roses.example: Work is important, but remember to stop and smell the roses.

storm_in_a_teacup.meaning: unnecessary fuss about a small matter
storm_in_a_teacup.explanation: A situation that seems serious but is actually trivial
storm_in_a_teacup.example: The argument over the meeting time is just a storm in a teacup.
storm_in_a_teacup.hindi_meaning: छोटी बात को बड़ा बना देना

straight_from_the_horse_s_mouth.explanation: Information received directly from someone involved
straight_from_the_horse_s_mouth.example: I got this news straight from the horse's mouth.

strike_while_the_iron_is_hot.english: strike while the iron is hot
strike_while_the_iron_is_hot.meaning: take advantage of a situation while it's favorable
strike_while_the_iron_is_hot.explanation: Act quickly when an opportunity is present
strike_while_the_iron_is_hot.example: You got a job offer; strike while the iron is hot!

take_a_hike.meaning: go away or leave someone alone
take_a_hike.explanation: To tell someone to go away, often dismissively
take_a_hike.example: He told me to take a hike when I asked for help.
take_a_hike.hindi_meaning: किसी को जाने के लिए कहना

take_it_with_a_grain_of_salt.english: take it with a grain of salt
take_it_with_a_grain_of_salt.explanation: To not fully trust or believe something
take_it_with_a_grain_of_salt.example: Take his advice with a grain of salt.
take_it_with_a_grain_of_salt.hindi_meaning: किसी बात पर पूरी तरह विश्वास न करना

talk_is_cheap.meaning: it's easy to say things but hard to do them
talk_is_cheap.example: Talk is cheap; show me your results.
talk_is_cheap.hindi_meaning: कहना आसान है लेकिन करना मुश्किल है

the_early_bird_gets_the_worm.english: the early bird gets the worm
the_early_bird_gets_the_worm.meaning: success comes to those who start early
the_early_bird_gets_the_worm.explanation: Being first or early gives an advantage
the_early_bird_gets_the_worm.example: The early bird gets the worm, so wake up on time!
the_early_bird_gets_the_worm.hindi: जल्दी उठने वाले को फायदा मिलता है
the_early_bird_gets_the_worm.hindi_meaning: समय पर काम करने से सफलता मिलती है

throw_in_the_towel.explanation: To stop trying and accept failure
throw_in_the_towel.example: After many attempts, he threw in the towel.

tight_as_a_drum.explanation: Something that's very tight or tense
tight_as_a_drum.example: The rope was tied tight as a drum.

to_each_their_own.example: Some like coffee, some like tea. To each their own!
to_each_their_own.hindi_meaning: सभी की अपनी-अपनी रुचि होती है

too_little_too_late.meaning: not enough help given after it's too late
too_little_too_late.explanation: An effort that comes after an opportunity has passed
too_little_too_late.example: His apology was too little too late.
too_little_too_late.hindi_meaning: बहुत देर के बाद कम प्रयास

touch_and_go.meaning: uncertain or risky; could go either way
touch_and_go.example: Whether he'll recover is touch and go.

tough_nut_to_crack.explanation: Something that's hard to understand or accomplish
tough_nut_to_crack.example: This math problem is a tough nut to crack.

under_the_weather.explanation: To be ill or feeling bad
under_the_weather.example: I'm under the weather today, so I'll work from home.

up_the_creek.meaning: in a difficult situation with no solution
up_the_creek.example: Without that job, I'm up the creek.

use_your_loaf.example: Use your loaf! There must be a simple solution.

vanish_in_thin_air.example: He vanished in thin air without telling anyone.
vanish_in_thin_air.hindi_meaning: बिना किसी को बताए चले जाना

waiting_in_the_wings.meaning: ready to take over if needed
waiting_in_the_wings.explanation: A backup plan or person ready when needed
waiting_in_the_wings.example: The vice president is waiting in the wings.

warm_welcome.example: We gave them a warm welcome to our home.

washed_up.meaning: past your prime; no longer successful
washed_up.explanation: To be finished or no longer relevant

water_under_the_bridge.meaning: past events that can't be changed
water_under_the_bridge.explanation: To let go of the past and move forward
water_under_the_bridge.example: Let's forget about the past; it's water under the bridge.
water_under_the_bridge.hindi_meaning: जो बीत गया वह भूल जाओ

wear_your_heart_on_your_sleeve.english: wear your heart on your sleeve
wear_your_heart_on_your_sleeve.explanation: To let everyone know how you feel
wear_your_heart_on_your_sleeve.example: She wears her heart on her sleeve about everything.

weather_the_storm.explanation: To endure hardship and come out okay
weather_the_storm.example: The company weathered the economic storm.

weed_out.explanation: To eliminate or get rid of something bad
weed_out.example: We need to weed out bad employees.

week_of_sundays.example: It's been a week of Sundays since I last saw you.

well_heeled.explanation: Someone who has a lot of money

what_goes_around_comes_around.explanation: Consequences for your actions eventually catch up
what_goes_around_comes_around.example: He mistreated people, but what goes around comes around.
what_goes_around_comes_around.hindi_meaning: अपने कर्मों का फल अवश्य मिलता है

when_all_is_said_and_done.english: when all is said and done
when_all_is_said_and_done.example: When all is said and done, family is most important.
when_all_is_said_and_done.hindi_meaning: सब कुछ विचार करने के बाद

when_push_comes_to_shove.meaning: when forced to make a difficult decision
when_push_comes_to_shove.example: When push comes to shove, he'll do the right thing.

whole_new_ball_game.explanation: Something that changes the circumstances entirely
whole_new_ball_game.example: With the new technology, it's a whole new ball game.

win_hands_down.explanation: To win by a large margin with no difficulty
win_hands_down.example: He will win the race hands down.
win_hands_down.hindi_meaning: बिना किसी प्रतिद्वंद्विता के आसानी से जीतना

wipe_the_slate_clean.explanation: To erase the past and begin anew
wipe_the_slate_clean.example: After the apology, let's wipe the slate clean.
wipe_the_slate_clean.hindi_meaning: बीते हुए को भूलकर नई शुरुआत करना

wise_as_an_owl.explanation: Someone with great wisdom and knowledge
wise_as_an_owl.example: Grandpa is wise as an owl.

wish_upon_a_star.explanation: To make a silent wish, often with hope
wish_upon_a_star.example: She wished upon a star for happiness.
wish_upon_a_star.hindi_meaning: सितारों को देखकर दिल की बात कहना

without_a_doubt.example: He is, without a doubt, the best player.

wolf_in_sheep_clothing.meaning: a dangerous person pretending to be harmless
wolf_in_sheep_clothing.explanation: Someone with evil intentions appearing innocent
wolf_in_sheep_clothing.example: He seemed nice, but he was a wolf in sheep's clothing.
wolf_in_sheep_clothing.hindi_meaning: खतरनाक व्यक्ति जो शांत दिखता है

words_fail_me.meaning: I don't know what to say
words_fail_me.explanation: Unable to express feelings due to amazement
words_fail_me.example: Words fail me to describe how beautiful it is!
words_fail_me.hindi_meaning: इतना आश्चर्य कि कुछ कहना मुश्किल हो

work_like_a_dog.explanation: To put in a lot of effort and labor
work_like_a_dog.example: He works like a dog to support his family.

world_weary.explanation: Exhausted by the complexities of life
world_weary.example: He had a world-weary expression on his face.

worst_nightmare.explanation: A situation that's the most bad
worst_nightmare.example: Forgetting her wedding day would be her worst nightmare.

worthy_adversary.explanation: Someone who is strong and skilled enough to be a good opponent
worthy_adversary.example: She proved to be a worthy adversary in debate.

wrong_side_of_the_bed.english: got up on the wrong side of the bed
wrong_side_of_the_bed.explanation: Waking up in a grumpy or foul mood
wrong_side_of_the_bed.example: Don't mind him; he got up on the wrong side of the bed.
wrong_side_of_the_bed.hindi_meaning: सुबह ही गुस्से में जाग जाना

yanking_your_chain.explanation: To pull someone's leg for fun
yanking_your_chain.example: I was just yanking your chain; I didn't mean it seriously.
yanking_your_chain.hindi_meaning: किसी को छेड़ना या मजाक करना

year_in_year_out.example: He does the same job year in, year out.

yellow_bellied.explanation: Someone who is afraid or lacks courage
yellow_bellied.example: He's too yellow-bellied to stand up for himself.

young_and_foolish.meaning: lack of wisdom due to youth
young_and_foolish.explanation: Youthful lack of judgment or experience
young_and_foolish.example: He was young and foolish when he made that decision.

your_guess_is_as_good_as_mine.english: your guess is as good as mine
your_guess_is_as_good_as_mine.example: What will happen next? Your guess is as good as mine!
your_guess_is_as_good_as_mine.hindi_meaning: मेरा अनुमान आपका जितना ही सही है

zero_tolerance.explanation: Strict policy with no exceptions allowed
zero_tolerance.example: The school has a zero tolerance policy for violence.
zero_tolerance.hindi_meaning: किसी भी त्रुटि को बर्दाश्त न करना

piece_of_cake.explanation: An easy task or accomplishment that requires little effort
piece_of_cake.example: The math test was a piece of cake for her.

break_a_leg.meaning: good luck with a performance or undertaking
break_a_leg.explanation: Theater tradition to wish someone success, despite its literal negative meaning
break_a_leg.example: Good luck on your presentation - break a leg!
break_a_leg.hindi_meaning: किसी को सफलता की कामना करना

cost_an_arm_and_a_leg.english: cost an arm and a leg
cost_an_arm_and_a_leg.explanation: Something that costs a lot of money, implying it's worth sacrificing a lot for
cost_an_arm_and_a_leg.example: That vacation cost us an arm and a leg.

better_half.explanation: A loving way to refer to a husband or wife
better_half.example: I'm going to the party with my better half.

at_the_end_of_the_day.english: at the end of the day
at_the_end_of_the_day.explanation: When all factors are taken into account; in the final analysis
at_the_end_of_the_day.example: At the end of the day, what matters most is our family.
at_the_end_of_the_day.hindi_meaning: सब कुछ विचार करने के बाद

time_is_money.meaning: time is valuable and shouldn't be wasted
time_is_money.explanation: Time should be used productively as it has economic value

it_is_raining_cats_and_dogs.explanation: Heavy rainfall, not literally animals falling from the sky
it_is_raining_cats_and_dogs.example: We can't go to the park today because it's raining cats and dogs.
it_is_raining_cats_and_dogs.hindi_meaning: बहुत तेज़ बारिश हो रही है
